summary: An email from an FBI ASAC in the New York Field Office regarding the Epstein investigation, instructing a subordinate to create and maintain a Sensitive Case Notification (SCN) with updates on multiple fronts including victim interviews, digital analysis, financial analysis, forfeiture, public corruption, and significant events like the search of Epstein's island. It emphasizes coordination and mentions a victim statement linking Epstein to a specific inquiry.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'JE' and is the central figure of the high-profile criminal investigation discussed in the email.

persons.name: CEOS
persons.context: A unit or group whose inclusion in the investigation is suggested as beneficial, particularly in light of a victim's statement about Epstein's inquiries.

persons.name: A/SC
persons.context: The Assistant Special Agent in Charge is briefing the Deputy Assistant Director on the Epstein case.

persons.name: DAD
persons.context: The Deputy Assistant Director is being briefed on the Epstein case by the A/SC.

persons.name: ASAC New York Field Office
persons.context: The author of the email, directing the management and tracking of the multi-faceted Epstein investigation from the New York Field Office, Criminal Branch C.

connections.description: The ASAC instructs the email recipient to call M to coordinate a conference call, indicating a working relationship.
The A/SC is briefing the DAD on the Epstein case, showing a supervisory reporting relationship.
The email suggests involving the CEOS unit because a victim's statement about Epstein's inquiries aligns with that unit's expertise.

events.title: Instruction to create Epstein SCN
events.description: An FBI ASAC sends an email directing the creation and weekly updating of a Sensitive Case Notification (SCN) to track all facets of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Search of Epstein's island
events.description: Referenced as a 'significant event' that should be detailed in the investigation updates.

events.title: Victim interview reveals Epstein inquiry
events.description: A victim interviewed the previous day stated that Epstein asked for her opinion about a specific subject, which the email author notes is 'right up the CP alley' and good for an affidavit.

keyFacts: The FBI New York Field Office was actively managing a multi-faceted investigation into Jeffrey Epstein in August 2019, tracking victim interviews, digital/financial analysis, forfeiture, public corruption, and events like the island search.

The investigation involved collaboration with the SDNY, an FBI squad (C-XX), and an outside vendor to review Epstein's investment accounts, noting specific large payments that coincided with Miami Herald reporting.
A victim's statement that Epstein asked for her opinion on a particular subject was considered highly relevant and suitable for an affidavit, prompting a suggestion to involve the CEOS unit.

The email shows high-level internal coordination, with an Assistant Special Agent in Charge briefing a Deputy Assistant Director and organizing conference calls to ensure all investigative fronts were tracked.
